content_blocks.content_html:
Who is behind DeepFindr?

The DeepFindr YouTube channel is run by me - Florian. I have an Engineering and Computer Science background and have always loved teaching since I gave guitar lessons 10+ years ago. Once I got involved into programming and tech the logical consequence was to do the same thing there: share knowledge.

What does the name DeepFindr stand for?

The name for the channel was a spontaneous idea and I would probably choose another name meanwhile ;-). You could say that the "Deep" part refers to Deep Learning and the "Findr" part to finding knowledge. To that end, the goal of this channel is to share compressed and insightful Machine Learning knowledge.

Why does DeepFindr exist?

I created this channel for several reasons. First of all, I love to be in contact with people from all over the world and like to exchange on the latest topics. Besides that, I have many friends that started with Machine Learning and had struggles understanding the university slides. That's why I thought it would be a great opportunity to animate and visualize complex subjects. Finally, I don't want to withhold from you that I hoped to get a little extra income to go out for a dinner every now and then. :)

I get a lot of messages every day from people asking for help in their projects. So far I answered every request and invested a lot of freetime into supporting and consulting. As of now, I decided to only take smaller questions, because I can't handle the large amount of inquries anymore.

If you need further assistance and also coding support, I offer consultancy but not free of charge anymore.

For more details get in touch via deepfindr@gmail.com.

If you are interested in any form of collaboration or just want to leave feedback, please do so using the E-Mail address below.

Click to send E-Mail to deepfindr@gmail.com.

Datenschutzerklärung

YouTube

Der von mir genutzte YouTube Kanal gehört Google Ireland Limited, Gordon House, 4 Barrow St, Dublin, D04 E5W5, Irland. Angaben darüber, welche Daten durch Google verarbeitet und zu welchen Zwecken genutzt werden, finden Sie in der Datenschutzerklärung von Google. Ich habe keinen Einfluss auf Art und Umfang der durch Google verarbeiteten Daten, die Art der Verarbeitung und Nutzung oder die Weitergabe dieser Daten an Dritte.

GMail

Zur Kontaktaufnahme verwende ich den E-Mail Dienst G-Mail. Die Datenschutzerklärung von G-Mail finden Sie hier. Ich verarbeite personenbezogene Daten wie E-Mail Addressen oder Namen nicht weiter und gebe diese auch nicht an Externe weiter. Auf Anfrage können alle gespeicherten Daten aus einer Kontaktaufnahme sofort gelöscht werden, falls dies gewünscht wird.

content_blocks.title: Hi there!
content_blocks.description_html: I'm Data Science Enthusiast and Programming Lover. I share my learnings in short YouTube videos, covering various topics like Explainable AI, Graph Neural Networks, Generative Deep Learning, ML Ops, Computer Vision or Uncertainty Estimation.

content_blocks.title: Latest Videos
content_blocks.description_html: Each step you take reveals a new horizon.

content_blocks.title: My videos
content_blocks.description:
Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
- Vincent Van Gogh

videos.title: Understanding Graph Neural Networks
videos.subtitle: Beginner Tutorial
videos.excerpt: This is a beginner video series in which I explain how Graph Neural Networks work and demostrate how to implement them using Pytorch Geometric. The series consists of three parts. Part 1 is a general introduction, part 2 goes into detail what Message Passing is and how to calculate it and part 3 is a hands-on session using a molecule dataset.
videos.content: This is a beginner video series in which I explain how Graph Neural Networks work and demostrate how to implement them using Pytorch Geometric. The series consists of three parts. Part 1 is a general introduction, part 2 goes into detail what Message Passing is and how to calculate it and part 3 is a hands-on session using a molecule dataset.

videos.title: Node Classification on Knowledge Graphs
videos.subtitle: Pytorch Geometric Tutorial
videos.excerpt: In this video I explain how to perform Node Classification with Graph Neural Networks on Knowledge graphs. As usually, I work with Pytorch Geometric and share both theoretical and practical details.
videos.content: In this video I explain how to perform Node Classification with Graph Neural Networks on Knowledge graphs. As usually, I work with Pytorch Geometric and share both theoretical and practical details.

videos.title: Understanding Convolutional Neural Networks
videos.subtitle: Hands-on series
videos.excerpt: This is a hands-on video series on Convolutional Neural Networks. After going in depth on the theory, we build a CNN for classifying the 7 wonders of the world. Hope you enjoy it!
videos.content: This is a hands-on video series on Convolutional Neural Networks. After going in depth on the theory, we build a CNN for classifying the 7 wonders of the world. Hope you enjoy it!

videos.title: How to use edge features in GNNs
videos.subtitle: ... and Pytorch Geometric
videos.excerpt: The key component of Graph Neural Networks are obviously node features. But how do you include edge information into the message passing mechanism? I talk about several possibilities in this video.
videos.content: The key component of Graph Neural Networks are obviously node features. But how do you include edge information into the message passing mechanism? I talk about several possibilities in this video.

videos.title: Explainable AI explained!
videos.subtitle: A holistic video-series
videos.excerpt: I worked on a research project with explainable AI and read dozens of papers back then. I compressed all my learnings into this short video series and capture everything from LIME, over SHAP to Counterfactuals. Hope you enjoy it!
videos.content: I worked on a research project with explainable AI and read dozens of papers back then. I compressed all my learnings into this short video series and capture everything from LIME, over SHAP to Counterfactuals. Hope you enjoy it!

videos.title: Understanding Graph Attention Networks
videos.subtitle: In-depth explanation
videos.excerpt: Graph Attention Networks are a special variant of Graph Neural Networks that employ the popular attention mechanism. In this video I talk about the details of this layer.
videos.content: Graph Attention Networks are a special variant of Graph Neural Networks that employ the popular attention mechanism. In this video I talk about the details of this layer.

videos.title: GNN Project with Molecules
videos.subtitle: using Pytorch Geometric
videos.excerpt: This video series captures a lot of interesting things such as Graph Transformers, Graph Variational Autoencoders, One-shot molecule generation and Graph Pooling Mechanisms. It’s a great mix of theory and practice and I hope you enjoy it :)
videos.content: This video series captures a lot of interesting things such as Graph Transformers, Graph Variational Autoencoders, One-shot molecule generation and Graph Pooling Mechanisms. It’s a great mix of theory and practice and I hope you enjoy it :)

videos.title: Machine Lerning Model Deployment
videos.subtitle: with MlFlow and Streamlit
videos.excerpt: After building a great machine learning model often the following question arises: How do you provide your solution to the end users? Therefore, I show some possibilities in this quick video series, talking about ML Ops, Deployment and more. I also build a simple Dashboard with Streamlit. :)
videos.content: After building a great machine learning model often the following question arises: How do you provide your solution to the end users? Therefore, I show some possibilities in this quick video series, talking about ML Ops, Deployment and more. I also build a simple Dashboard with Streamlit. :)

videos.title: Explainable AI meets Graph Neural Networks
videos.subtitle: GNNExplainer in detail
videos.excerpt: After uploading a GNN video series and a XAI video series the logical next step is to combine these two worlds. How do you apply explainability techniques on GNNs? This and more in the video below :)
videos.content: After uploading a GNN video series and a XAI video series the logical next step is to combine these two worlds. How do you apply explainability techniques on GNNs? This and more in the video below :)

videos.title: GNNExplainer in Practice
videos.subtitle: Finding Twitch streamers with explicit language
videos.excerpt: Based on the previous video about Explainability for GNNs, I will demonstrate how to use these tools in practice. In this video I apply the GNNExplainer to a Twitch Streamer Dataset, with the task of predicting streamers with explicit language.
videos.content: Based on the previous video about Explainability for GNNs, I will demonstrate how to use these tools in practice. In this video I apply the GNNExplainer to a Twitch Streamer Dataset, with the task of predicting streamers with explicit language.

videos.title: Python Graph Neural Network Libraries
videos.subtitle: An Overview
videos.excerpt: There are lots of great libraries out there for using Graph Neural Networks in Python. In this video I do a quick comparison of the most popular libraries and also talk about my personal preference.
videos.content: There are lots of great libraries out there for using Graph Neural Networks in Python. In this video I do a quick comparison of the most popular libraries and also talk about my personal preference.

videos.title: Friendly Introduction to Temporal Graph Neural Networks
videos.subtitle: And some traffic forecasting
videos.excerpt: Combining time-series models with graph models has led to amazing breakthroughs in fields like Traffic Prediction. Google has recently published a paper where the spatio-temporal Graph Neural Network outperformed the current ETA prediction model. In this video I give a friendly introduction to these models and explain their inner workings.
videos.content: Combining time-series models with graph models has led to amazing breakthroughs in fields like Traffic Prediction. Google has recently published a paper where the spatio-temporal Graph Neural Network outperformed the current ETA prediction model. In this video I give a friendly introduction to these models and explain their inner workings.

videos.title: Traffic Forecasting
videos.subtitle: With Pytorch Geometric Temporal
videos.excerpt: Based on the introduction of Spatio-Temporal GNNs, I do a hands-on session for traffic prediction in this video. More specifically, we will predict the normalized speed for a Los Angeles Traffic network.
videos.content: Based on the introduction of Spatio-Temporal GNNs, I do a hands-on session for traffic prediction in this video. More specifically, we will predict the normalized speed for a Los Angeles Traffic network.

videos.title: Fraud Detection
videos.subtitle: With Graph Neural Networks
videos.excerpt: There are lots of frauds on the internet - from credit card scammers to fake news propagation. Graph Neural Networks are used in many scenarios to predict fraudulent nodes. In this video I capture the basics to get started with Fraud Detection using GNNs.
videos.content: There are lots of frauds on the internet - from credit card scammers to fake news propagation. Graph Neural Networks are used in many scenarios to predict fraudulent nodes. In this video I capture the basics to get started with Fraud Detection using GNNs.

videos.title: Fake News Detection
videos.subtitle: using Pytorch Geometric
videos.excerpt: Based on a community voting, I build a GNN model for fake news detection in this video. More specifically, it’s a mix of a BERT word embedding model and a Graph model. I hope you find it helpful!
videos.content: Based on a community voting, I build a GNN model for fake news detection in this video. More specifically, it’s a mix of a BERT word embedding model and a Graph model. I hope you find it helpful!

videos.title: Recommender Systems
videos.subtitle: using Graph Neural Networks
videos.excerpt: Recommender Systems have a long history using matrix factorization as primary method. Nowaday, in many cases Graph Neural Networks can be used to improve recommender systems, as they allow a broader aggregation of the neighborhood and therefore lead to more powerful representations. In this video I teach all the basics you need to get started with GNNs + recommenders :)
videos.content: Recommender Systems have a long history using matrix factorization as primary method. Nowaday, in many cases Graph Neural Networks can be used to improve recommender systems, as they allow a broader aggregation of the neighborhood and therefore lead to more powerful representations. In this video I teach all the basics you need to get started with GNNs + recommenders :)

videos.title: How to handle Uncertainty
videos.subtitle: Deep Learning Edition
videos.excerpt: Being able to predict uncertainty is a very powerful skill for every Data Scientist! It not only provides better insights into the machine learning model, but also helps the end-users to build trust in your application. This video series consists of 4 videos, which talk about both - the theory and implementation of epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty. Captured methods include Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Quantile Regression, Deep Ensembles, and Bayesian Neural Networks.
videos.content: Being able to predict uncertainty is a very powerful skill for every Data Scientist! It not only provides better insights into the machine learning model, but also helps the end-users to build trust in your application. This video series consists of 4 videos, which talk about both - the theory and implementation of epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty. Captured methods include Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Quantile Regression, Deep Ensembles, and Bayesian Neural Networks.

videos.title: How to convert a Tabular Dataset to a Graph Dataset
videos.subtitle: for GNNs
videos.excerpt: This is for sure the most frequently asked question - given some tabular data - how can I apply a GNN on it? For this you need to convert your dataset into a Graph representation. I’ve uploaded two videos, one for regular graphs and a second one for temporal graphs that teach everything you need to know and showcase how to do it on several examples.
videos.content: This is for sure the most frequently asked question - given some tabular data - how can I apply a GNN on it? For this you need to convert your dataset into a Graph representation. I’ve uploaded two videos, one for regular graphs and a second one for temporal graphs that teach everything you need to know and showcase how to do it on several examples.

videos.title: How to get started with Data Science
videos.subtitle: a personal guidance
videos.excerpt: In this video I share my personal opinion on how I would get started with Data Science and also talk about the tech stack I use.
videos.content: In this video I share my personal opinion on how I would get started with Data Science and also talk about the tech stack I use.

videos.title: Causality and Graph Neural Networks
videos.subtitle: an introduction
videos.excerpt: Causality answers the question of “What if” and is a useful tool to understand the reasoning process of data. Recent works have started to combine Graph Neural Networks with Structural Causal Models (SCMs) which opens a new promising research direction. The ultimate goal is to combine the best of both worlds to jointly learn causal relationships and powerful models. More about it in this video …
videos.content: Causality answers the question of “What if” and is a useful tool to understand the reasoning process of data. Recent works have started to combine Graph Neural Networks with Structural Causal Models (SCMs) which opens a new promising research direction. The ultimate goal is to combine the best of both worlds to jointly learn causal relationships and powerful models. More about it in this video …

videos.title: Diffusion models from Scratch
videos.subtitle: in PyTorch
videos.excerpt: Diffusion models are a popular new method in the field of generative deep learning. They are used in a lot of SOTA architectures and recently had breakthroughs in text to image generation (DALL-E 2, IMAGEN…). In order to fully understand these models, I thought it might be helpful to build one from scratch. In this video I implement a DDPM (Denosing Diffusion Probabilistic Model) and explain some of the theory on the way. Hope you enjoy it!
videos.content: Diffusion models are a popular new method in the field of generative deep learning. They are used in a lot of SOTA architectures and recently had breakthroughs in text to image generation (DALL-E 2, IMAGEN…). In order to fully understand these models, I thought it might be helpful to build one from scratch. In this video I implement a DDPM (Denosing Diffusion Probabilistic Model) and explain some of the theory on the way. Hope you enjoy it!
